intro: Duretia quelpaertensis, commonly known as the Jeju island bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Jeju in South Korea. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the unique climate of Jeju. It has lance-shaped leaves and is often found in coastal areas or on mountain slopes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
